title: The Kincaid and James Crime Collection - Deborah Crombie
description:
Audio Books : Mystery and Suspense : Other quality : English


All are unabridged. Most are CD quality, except for #7 A Finer End which is still only available on cassette tapes.
Half of these titles are recorded at 32 kbps / 22 kHz Mono CBR Fraunhofer. The other half are 48 kbps / 44 kHz Mono CBR.
Most are narrated by either Michael Deehy or Jenny Sterlin.



Deborah Crombie just might be the most British of the American mystery novelists in her excellent UK based crime series featuring Duncan Kincaid, an inoffensively upper-class Scotland Yard superintendent, and Sergeant Gemma James, his rougher-edged partner. In addition to her finely tuned ear for the subtler nuances of Britspeak, Crombie achieves a rare balance between the details of her characters' private lives and the plot of each particular book. (JJM)

01. A Share in Death (1993) narrated by Michael Deehy, 7 hours 5 min.


02. All Shall be Well (1994) narrated by Michael Deehy, 8 hours 27 mins.

03. Leave the Grave Green (1995) narrated by Christopher Kay, 9 hours 17 mins.


04. Mourn not your Dead (1996) narrated by Michael Deehy, 9 hours 5 mins. (Thanks to Gus for this CD quality copy).


05. Dreaming of the Bones (1997) narrated by Jenny Sterlin, 14 hours 20 mins.


06. Kissed a Sad Goodbye (1999) narrated by Jenny Sterlin, 14 hours 27 mins. (Thanks to Gus for this CD quality copy).


07. A Finer End (2001) narrated by Jenny Sterlin, 12 hours 7 mins. Cassettes.


08. And Justice is there None (2002) narrated by Michael Deehy, 11 hours 35 mins.


09. Now May You Weep (2003) narrated by Michael Deehy, 11 hours 54 mins.


10. In a Dark House (2004) narrated by Jenny Sterlin, 12 hours 18 mins.


11. Water Like a Stone (2006) narrated by Gordon Griffin, 15 hours 9 mins.


12. Where Memories Lie (2008) narrated by Jenny Sterlin, 10 hours 40 mins.

13. Necessary as Blood (2009) narrated by Jenny Sterlin, 13 hours 28 mins. (Thanks to Zwarbles for this copy).


14. No Mark Upon Her (2011) narrated by Gerard Doyle, 12 hours 21 mins. (Thanks to Phyl for this copy).


15. The Sound of Broken Glass (2013) narrated by Gerard Doyle, 15 hours 9 mins. (Thanks to Stoker for this copy).


16. To Dwell in Darkness (2014) narrated by Gerard Doyle, 10 hours 33 mins. (Thanks to MC for this copy).



Enjoy and Seed!!
